sen.j: 小出 英利（こいで ふさとし、万治2年10月14日 (旧暦)（1659年11月28日） － 正徳 (日本)3年2月17日 (旧暦)（1713年3月13日））は、丹波国園部藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: Fusatoshi KOIDE (November 28, 1659 - March 13, 1713) was the third feudal lord of Sonobe District, Tanba Province.
Fusatoshi KOIDE (November 28, 1659 - March 13, 1713) was the third feudal lord of Sonobe District, Tanba Province.
Fusatoshi KOIDE (November 28, 1659 - March 13, 1713) was the third feudal lord of Sonobe Domain, Tanba Province.
He was the third generation of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the third generation of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the third generation of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.

sen.j: 第2代藩主・小出英知の長男。
sen.e: Fusatoshi was the first son of Fusatomo KOIDE who was the second feudal lord.
Fusatoshi was the first son of Fusatomo KOIDE who was the second feudal lord.
Fusatoshi was the first son of Fusatomo KOIDE who was the second feudal lord.
His legal wife was a daughter of Masatoshi INOUE.
His legal wife was a daughter of Masatoshi INOUE.
His legal wife was a daughter of Masatoshi INOUE.

sen.j: 子に小出英貞（次男）、小出英雄（三男）、小出英治（四男）、娘（片桐貞経正室）。
sen.e: His children were Fusasada KOIDE (second son), Fusao KOIDE (third son), Fusaharu KOIDE (fourth son) and a daughter (Sadatsune KATAGIRI's legal wife).
His children were Fusasada KOIDE (second son), Fusao KOIDE (third son), Fusaharu KOIDE (fourth son) and a daughter (Sadatsune KATAGIRI's legal wife).
His children were Fusasada KOIDE (second son), Fusao KOIDE (third son), Fusaharu KOIDE (fourth son) and a daughter (Sadatsune KATAGIRI's legal wife).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、伊勢国守。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the position was the director of Ise Province.
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the position was the director of Ise Province.
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the position was the director of Ise Province.
His first name was Kissho (吉尚).
His first name was Kissho (吉尚).
His first name was Kissho (吉尚).

sen.j: 延宝元年（1673年）10月27日、父の隠居により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: On October 27, 1673, he took over as head of the family because of his father's retirement.
On October 27, 1673, he took over as head of the family because of his father's retirement.
On December 5, 1673, he took over as head of the family because of his father's retirement.

sen.j: 浅草門の普請役や永井尚長改易後の丹後国宮津城受け取り役を務めた。
sen.e: He served as a Fushin yaku of the Asakusa-mon Gate and a Uketori-yaku of the Miyazu-jo Castle in Tango Province after Naonaga NAGAI forfeited the domain.
He served as a Fushin yaku of the Asakusa-mon Gate and a Uketori-yaku of the Miyazu-jo Castle in Tango Province after Naonaga NAGAI forfeited the domain.
He served as a Fushin yaku of the Asakusa-mon Gate and a Uketori-yaku of the Miyazu-jo Castle in Tango Province after Naonaga NAGAI forfeited the domain.

sen.j: 貞享元年（1684年）に英利と改名する。
sen.e: He changed his name to Fusatoshi in 1684.
He changed his name to Fusatoshi in 1684.
He changed his name to Fusatoshi in 1684.

sen.j: 宝永2年（1705年）4月22日、次男・英貞に家督を譲って隠居し、正徳3年（1713年）2月17日に55歳で死去した。
sen.e: On April 22, 1705, he transferred the responsibility for the family to his second son, Fusasada and went into retirement, then died on February 17, 1713 at the age of 55.
On April 22, 1705, he transferred the responsibility for the family to his second son, Fusasada and went into retirement, then died on February 17, 1713 at the age of 55.
On May 14, 1705, he transferred the responsibility for the family to his second son, Fusasada and went into retirement, then died on March 13, 1713 at the age of 55.
His hogo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Zuihogikoreio-in (瑞峯義光霊応院).
sen.cmt: 瑞峯義光霊応院→Zuihogikoreio-in[定訳不明]
sen.e: His hogo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Zuihogikoreio-in (瑞峯義光霊応院).
